title: to (c) of that subsection as they relate to the body to which the following order
heading: 1. This Order may be cited as the Civil Law and Criminal Law
text_raw:
1. This Order may be cited as the Civil Law and Criminal Law 
(Miscellaneous Provisions) Act 2020 (Section 31) (Appeals Officers) 
(Designation) Order 2020.
text_norm: 1 order may cited civil law criminal law (miscellaneous provisions) act 2020 (section 31) (appeals officers) (designation) order 2020

title: to (c) of that subsection as they relate to the body to which the following order
heading: 2. An appeals officer (within the meaning of section 2(1) of the Social
text_raw:
2. An appeals officer (within the meaning of section 2(1) of the Social 
Welfare Consolidation Act 2005 (No. 26 of 2005)) is, for the purposes of section 
31 of the Civil Law and Criminal Law (Miscellaneous Provisions) Act 2020 (No. 
13 of 2020), designated and may hold hearings before him or her by remote 
hearing. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

12 November, 2020. 

HEATHER HUMPHREYS, 

Minister for Social Protection. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 17th November, 2020. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [523] 3

title: to (c) of that subsection as they relate to the body to which the following order
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

Section 313 of the Social Welfare Consolidation Act 2005 provides that Appeals 
Officers, in consideration of any matter referred to them (appeals of unsuccessful 
claims, etc.) may hold hearings. 

Section 31 of the Civil and Criminal Law (Miscellaneous Provisions) Act 2020 
provides that a body established by or under an enactment may be designated for 
the purposes of that section as a body which may hold hearings by remote 
hearing. 

These Regulations provide that Appeals Officers may hold hearings remotely by 
electronic means. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [523]
